title: Witness: I'm a lifelong Republican; I'm embarrassed
description: Mike Bowen, a protective equipment manufacturer who warned about the lack of PPE, testified more lives will be lost if the US government doesn't listen to scientists.

title: Russia being accused of undercounting Covid-19 deaths
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports Russia's method of counting Covid-19 deaths have led to what critics call a suspiciously low number in Moscow.

title: Controlled explosion destroys two cooling towers
description: A spectacular controlled explosion has demolished the two cooling towers of a disused nuclear power plant in southwestern Germany.

title: Pandemic's impact on global mental health is 'already extremely concerning', UN says
description: There is a "high prevalence" of mental distress in countries across the globe due to the coronavirus pandemic, especially among health care workers and children, according to the United Nations and the World Health Organization.

title: Rick Bright testifies that the US doesn't have a comprehensive strategy to protect American lives
Appeals court lets emoluments lawsuit against Trump proceed
description: An appeals court Thursday morning rejected an attempt by President Donald Trump to stop an emoluments lawsuit challenging his ownership of a hotel in Washington, DC.

title: Tens of thousands under lockdown evacuate as Typhoon Vongfong strikes Philippines
description: Typhoon Vongfong has made landfall in the Philippines, forcing the evacuation of tens of thousands of people in a country under lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Beyoncé shares video of mobile Covid-19 testing sites she set up in her hometown
description: Beyoncé Knowles-Carter has shared a new video of the mobile Covid-19 testing sites she set up with her mother Tina Knowles-Lawson in their hometown of Houston, Texas.

title: Is Rick Bright's apocalyptic warning right?
Hundreds of fossilized human footprints found in Africa could reveal ancient traditions
description: Hundreds of fossilized human footprints made between 5,760 and 19,100 years ago have been discovered in Africa, shedding light on what life was like in ancient communities, according to a new study. This represents the largest collection of fossilized footprints found in Africa to date.

title: Trump finally broke with Fauci
Tina Fey's daughter crashes interview, calls mom a loser
description: While Tina Fey was doing an interview with Seth Meyers, her daughter made an appearance to poke fun at her mom.

title: 'The full story' about Ahmaud Arbery's killing is yet to be revealed, suspect's attorneys say in first statement
Massacre at maternity ward shows a chilling truth for women in Afghanistan
description: Afghanistan's "peace deal" has been blown up. The government has resumed fighting the Taliban after a horrifying attack by gunmen on a maternity ward run by Doctors Without Borders in Kabul. Mothers and nurses were the main victims in the first attack, with 16 killed. Two of the dead were newborns.

title: Elon Musk is using his power to be selfish
Doctors in Italy make a link between Covid-19 and rare 'Kawasaki-like' inflammatory disease in children
Sharon Osbourne weighs in on body image debate after Adele's viral Instagram post
description: Sharon Osbourne has praised Adele's weight loss, adding that she does not believe "really big women" are "really happy" in their bodies.

title: What eating in a restaurant may look like during the pandemic
description: Michelin-starred meals via delivery. Instagram Live cooking demos. Gourmet boxes from community supported agriculture.

title: Is Rick Bright's apocalyptic warning right?
description: In prepared testimony for his appearance before the US House Energy and Commerce subcommittee on Health on Thursday, Rick Bright said he was removed as the director of the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority because he was raising the alarm about the coronavirus early this year and also resisting pressure from the Trump administration to promote an "unproven drug, hydroxychloroquine, to the American people without transparent information on the potential health risks."

title: Jared Kushner's bizarre comment
description: When Jared Kushner speaks in public, very often he reveals the most dangerous truths about the Trump administration. The latest jaw-dropper came on Tuesday, when the son-in-law and top adviser to President Donald Trump casually cast doubt on whether the next presidential election will absolutely take place, as scheduled, and as mandated by law, on November 3.

title: Police examine CCTV footage of rail worker who died from Covid-19 after alleged spitting incident
description: Police are examining CCTV footage after a British transport worker died with coronavirus 14 days after being allegedly spat on in a busy London station.

title: Trump pushes 'Obamagate' conspiracy based on routine intel activity
description: GOP senators released a list of Obama administration officials who sought to "unmask" names of Americans in intelligence reports in the weeks before President Trump took office. CNN's Sara Murray reports.

title: Elle Fanning dressed up as Brad Pitt and nailed it
description: Elle Fanning may have won the Doppelgänger Challenge.

title: Man arrested after allegedly shooting and stabbing multiple people in California rampage
description: A man has been arrested on suspicion of shooting and stabbing multiple people during a rampage through Rancho Cucamonga, California.

title: Italy doctors link Covid-19 with rare disease in children
description: Doctors in Italy have become the latest to raise the alarm over a worrying spike in children getting sick with a rare but serious inflammatory syndrome they say is tied to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Can a hashtag help your mental health in isolation?
description: Model and activist Adwoa Aboah understands how scary the isolation brought on by the coronavirus pandemic can be, but she wants you to know you're not alone.

title: Black light experiment shows how quickly a virus like Covid-19 can spread at a restaurant
description: A viral video from Japan aims to show how easily germs and viruses can spread in restaurants when just one person is infected.

title: Magnus Carlsen's next move is to launch $1 million online chess tour
description: Magnus Carlsen, the chess superstar, is making a new move to boost the sport's popularity.

title: Melissa Etheridge's son, Beckett Cypher, dies at 21
description: Beckett Cypher, the son of Melissa Etheridge and her former partner Julie Cypher, has died, a representative for the singer told CNN. He was 21.

title: What you need to know about coronavirus today
description: The delicate dynamic between President Donald Trump and Dr. Anthony Fauci appears to be fraying, as Trump on Wednesday broke with the leading US expert who has become a voice of calm and reason amid the White House's chaotic coronavirus response.

title: Jerome Powell is asking for help. Will anyone listen?
description: Jerome Powell needs help.

title: Coronavirus may 'never go away,' says WHO official
description: The coronavirus spreading across the globe might never be eliminated, a leading World Health Organization official has said.

title: Paul Simon praises 'extraordinary' rendition of 'Bridge Over Troubled Water' by health workers
description: Paul Simon has praised "brave" health care workers who recorded an emotional rendition of the hit Simon & Garfunkel single "Bridge Over Troubled Water."

title: Nursing home workers warned government about safety violations before Covid-19 outbreaks and deaths
description: A flu shot will protect you from coronavirus, a worker reported being told by supervisors at a Rhode Island nursing home, where at least 60 residents were diagnosed with Covid-19 and at least one died.

title: Dele Alli tells of 'horrible experience' after assault and robbery
description: Tottenham Hotspur and England midfielder Dele Alli has told of his "horrible experience" after he was apparently robbed and assaulted at his North London home.

title: Demand for private islands is up as super rich seek an escape
description: While nearly all leisure travel remains paused because of the coronavirus pandemic, the demand for private islands is on the rise.

title: Judge slams the brakes on William Barr's abuse of power
Oscar-winning director on risking it all for the perfect shot
description: Having survived an avalanche and been tested in some of the most remote places on earth, Jimmy Chin knows what it's like to be at the mercy of mother nature.

title: How much water do we really need to drink?
description: Here's some welcome news: Water can work wonders for your health.

title: US China tensions didn't begin with the coronavirus. They've been building for years
description: Relations between the United States and China have sunk to new lows in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, with both sides hoping to make political gains by blaming the other for the severity of the crisis.

title: Can the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland survive as a union of four nations?
description: The UK's coronavirus crisis has reignited one of the country's most bitter political debates: Can the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland survive as a union of four nations?

title: Hear 911 call McMichael made days before Ahmaud Arbery's shooting
description: Less than two weeks before the February 23 shooting that left Ahmaud Arbery dead, a suspect arrested in the case had a confrontation with an unidentified African-American man who had entered a neighboring house under construction, according to an attorney for the owner of that house.

title: How expensive will air travel be after the Covid-19 crisis?
description: When the state of Florida began enacting stay-at-home measures and closing beaches in mid-March, in response to the threat of Covid-19, Miami-based real estate agent and artist Nadia Bouzid was in the middle of painting a mural inside a new hotel in Cancun, Mexico.

title: Black light experiment shows how quickly a virus spreads
description: Contact tracing is becoming increasingly important in containing the spread of the coronavirus as states push to re-open. CNN's Tom Foreman has more.

title: Videos show skydivers spiraling in sky before crashing
description: Eyewitnesses in Florida captured two skydivers spinning in the sky before they crashed into a tree and landed in front of a home, according to police and firefighters in Titusville.
